title: A deco font, perhaps?
content:
This is a hard font to classify. I find the top-only serif on the I interesting. I only have a limited font sample, so not sure if there are other characters that are similar.

Any help identifying this one would be appreciated - I've been searching for the answer to this one for quite a while now, and have had no luck. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415071921im_/http:/typophile.com/files/communications_6233.png)

Font: 

 Flexure 

Solved By: 

 [oldnick](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415071921/http:/typophile.com/user/6470 "View user profile.")
author: Nighttide

comments.content:
It looks like Flexure, condensed a bit and obliqued...

[https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/flexure/flexure/glyphs.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415071921/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/flexure/flexure/glyphs.html "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/flexure/flexure/glyphs.html")
I think you're right, oldnick! Thanks!
